Comment: The standard opening of masters in simuls everywhere, trying for an open game they can quickly win.
Kmoch takes a slow approach, keeping the way clear for P-QB3 to support his QP.
The amateur tries to crack Kmoch's center immediately.
Opting to liquidate the center at once.
Developing with a pin. But Ellison will have none of that...
...as he unpins with a check, and sets a subtle trap. White's correct response is 8 Q-Q2! [If Black then plays 8... B-N5, White can play 9 P-QB3, sealing the diagonal.]
Kmoch makes a horrible blunder with this natural-looking response.
Ellison pounces. Kmoch resigns, as there is no way to avoid the outright loss of a piece.
